solution_line_template: So each wall takes {wall_area}*{paint_rate_minutes_per_sq_meter}=<<{wall_area}*{paint_rate_minutes_per_sq_meter}={time_per_wall_minutes}>>{time_per_wall_minutes} minutes to paint
So it takes {time_per_wall_minutes}/{minutes_per_hour}=<<{time_per_wall_minutes}/{minutes_per_hour}={time_per_wall_hours}>>{time_per_wall_hours} hour to paint each wall
That means in total it takes {num_walls}*{time_per_wall_hours}=<<{num_walls}*{time_per_wall_hours}={total_paint_time_hours}>>{total_paint_time_hours} hours to paint
So he has {total_time_available_hours}-{total_paint_time_hours}=<<{total_time_available_hours}-{total_paint_time_hours}={hours_left}>>{hours_left} hour left after finishing painting
